title: 3D golden 8
content:
Please help me to ID this font, thank you very much in advance

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [c.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104645/http:/typophile.com/files/c_3.jpg) | 151.78 KB |

 [‹ (x) Script font - English Script (English 157) {Dav}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104645/http:/typophile.com/node/14435 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "STEREO" from 1960s record sleeve - Hellenic Wide {Dav} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104645/http:/typophile.com/node/14434 "Go to next forum topic")
author: contohabc

comments.content:
I think with the distortion and effects added to it and given the base character you are going to be fortunate to get a certain i.d. In fact given the junction it could even be created from scratch. Do you have any other more distinctive samples?  
Tim

Seriously, Ng Swee, it’s quite unlikely we’re going to be able to ID this typeface with just one number 8 — which is _not_ a distinctive character — that’s been extruded, bevelled, slanted _and_ shaded. :^)
Thank for your reply, I also think that it is not a font
